intro: Chrysolaena dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
